column4: my lan adapter (eth0) stopped working. i was using firestarter to route my internet coming form wlan (ath0) to eth0 when i came back from uni today my eth0 was dead. the switch wont even recocnise the cable is pluged in. anything i can check ? tried to ifdown and ifup with no results
uninstall Firestarter, enable ufw.
i have uninstalled firestarter what is ufw?
I have tried them all.
another firewall. Terminal: sudo su, ufw enable, ufw logging on, ufw default deny.
my network isnt working without the firewall anymore, i think i need to fix that first, or?
the firewall is not critical if you are behind a router with built-in hardware firewall.
as i said eth0 is dead. thats the problen i dont care if a fw is working or not
network config problem unrelated to firewall.
yes
try manual config
i did and i ifconfiged it to an ip no results
you will have to troubleshoot the problem and eliminate possible causes.
im pretty noobish. what would u advice i do next?
find a friend will some expertise.
thank you for your time. ill think ill try another distro then
re, i booted with another distro it worked so its not a hw issue of some kind is there any way i can reset all my network stuff to a working state?
you may have messed up the install. A failed network connection is often a first sign of that.
it worked till today. do you really think i have to reinstall?
can't say. Find a pratical solution to the problem.
are there any logs that could be of use nailing the problem down?
you would have to ask a Linux nerd in the room.
